{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3162199,"name":"Caleb Marshall","username":"N0tACyb0rg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/n0tacyb0rg/{size}/218596_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T16:01:36.826Z","cooked":"

Our robot has one SparkMAX (hooked up to a Neo) that consistently runs for around an extra second in our TeleOp compared to the other SparkMAXs. We determined all our wiring is good, and our SparkMAXs (6 for driving) are on factory settings (minus the CAN ID). We’re driving using DifferentialDrive’s arcadeDrive method, and all of the controllers’ idle modes are set to kCoast. I was wondering if anyone had any experience with this, and how to resolve it?

Have you compared settings using Rev Hardware Client?

Are all 6 on the latest firmware?

Do a swap of motor / SparkMax changing can ID to match

Are you running any debouncing of your inputs? Or are you experiencing a lot of command loop overruns in your driverstation log?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-03-13T13:39:03.883Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":15.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":429825,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-controller-lagging","display_username":"vargoose84","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28240,"username":"icemannie","name":"icemannie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/bc79bd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-controller-lagging/429825/3","custom_user_title":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3163457,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-13T13:49:10.196Z","cooked":"

Unless your CAN utilization is off the charts (which would cause other issues), motor controllers generally don’t lag like that, and especially not 1 second or more.

Step 1 should be to try swapping to a different controller to see if it does the same thing. If so, look into code and controller configuration, which is likely in code but anything not set in code will still have a value so check values in the REV Hardware Client as well.

There haven’t been any overrun warnings as far as I remember, but I’ll double-check today. (EDIT: We aren’t debouncing our joystick inputs. Should we?)
